attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Amnesty International has asked members of the British judiciary not to serve on any inquiry held under the Act, as they contend that "any inquiry would be controlled by the executive which is empowered to block public scrutiny of state actions."
This Act allows the Government to set the scope of the Inquiry, intercede and thwart the investigation, decide whether to hold hearings in private or public and decide which parts of the final report are made public.
